steps.name: Remove tape on drogue parachute, shroud lines, and shock cord.
Verify the parachute, shroud lines, and shock cord are free of damage.
Untangle parachute shroud lines
Z-fold the parachute
Wrap parachute with the small square of nomex
Connect the eye-bolt to the nomex with a quick link.
Verify that the drogue shock cord has a loop for parachute attachment.

content.text: The parachute should be connected roughly 2/3 along the shock cord from the forward end.

steps.name: Form bundles of shock cord every 8" along the length of the shock cord.

content.text: Secure bundles with masking tape. Ensure that the bundles are not too tight or sparse.

steps.name: Attach a quick link to the forward end of the shock cord.
Attach a quick link to the aft end of the shock cord.
Attach the drogue parachute to the center of the shock cord.

content.text: This connection and others on the harness will be re-verified before flight.

tokens.value: This connection and others on the harness will be re-verified before flight.

steps.name: Set aside the completed parachute and recovery harness.
Remove tape on main parachute, shroud lines, and shock cord.
Verify the parachute, shroud lines, and shock cord are free of damage.

content.text: Damage constitutes tears, rips, stiffened areas, burns, or singes.

steps.name: Untangle parachute shroud lines
Z-fold the parachute
Wrap parachute with the large square of nomex
Connect the parachute eye-bolt to the nomex with a quick link.
Verify that the main shock cord has a loop for parachute attachment.

content.text: The parachute should be connected roughly 2/3 along the shock cord from the forward end.

steps.name: Form bundles of shock cord every 8" along the length of the shock cord.

content.text: Secure bundles with masking tape. Ensure that the bundles are not too tight or sparse.

steps.name: Attach a quick link to the forward end of the shock cord.
Attach a quick link to the aft end of the shock cord.
Attach the main parachute to the center of the shock cord.

content.text: This connection and others on the harness will be re-verified before flight.

steps.name: Set aside the completed parachute and recovery harness.
Gather the following items:

content.text:
- 4x cardboard tube e-matches
- FFFFg Black Powder
- 1 cc measurement tool
- 0.5 cc measurement tool
- Cellulose insulation (dog barf)
- Tape
- Sharpie

tokens.value:
- 4x cardboard tube e-matches
- FFFFg Black Powder
- 1 cc measurement tool
- 0.5 cc measurement tool
- Cellulose insulation (dog barf)
- Tape
- Sharpie

steps.name: Construct the black power charges.

content.text:
Drogue Primary: 1.5 g
Drogue Backup: 2.0 g
Main Primary: 3.0 g
Main Backup: 3.5 g

Based on 12/6/24 ground testing

tokens.value:
Drogue Primary: 1.5 g
Drogue Backup: 2.0 g
Main Primary: 3.0 g
Main Backup: 3.5 g

Based on 12/6/24 ground testing

steps.name: Fully charge 2x large AltusMetrum LiPo batteries.
Connect primary computer to battery.
Connect backup computer to battery.
Connect forward (main parachute) quick-connects to bulkhead passthroughs.
Rotate avionics sled until 2x RBF tags are fully inserted.
Secure forward bulkhead in place by hand-tightening nuts.
Tighten nuts 3x rotations.
Connect jumper wires to 4x e-match passthroughs.

content.text: The goal here is to simulate connecting charges to verify continuity.

tokens.value: The goal here is to simulate connecting charges to verify continuity.

steps.name: Stand the avionics stack in the upright configuration.
Arm the backup computer.
Verify three continuity beeps.
Arm the primary computer.
Verify three continuity beeps.
Verify signal acquisition by TeleBT receiver.
Disarm primary computer.
Disarm backup computer.
Set the avionics stack aside to await vehicle integration.
Replace the AA batteries
Measure and record battery pack voltage.
Power on STEMCRaFT capsule by removing the RBF tag.
Violently shake the STEMCRaFT to simulate launch.
Wait 2:00 minutes to simulate flight.
Remove SD card and verify data collection.
Reinsert SD card.
Slide STEMCRaFT Capsule onto threaded rod.
Secure the bottom of the capslule with a 1/4-20 nut.
Slide the nose cone bulkhead onto the threaded rod.
Secure the nose cone bulkhead to the threaded rod.
Verify the nose cone bulkhead is secured.
Insert the threaded-rod-sled-bulkhead subassembly into the nosecone.
Rotate the subassembly inside the nosecone until the RBF tag is fully inserted.
Fasten the nose cone tip onto the threaded rod
Tighten bulkhead nut 1x full rotation.
Set the STEMCRaFT Payload aside to await vehicle integration.
Verify forward u-bolt is secured.
Verify aft stud is secured.
Verify forward and aft threaded rod nuts are secured.
Set the ADS payload aside to await vehicle integration.
Inspect fins and verify that they are undamaged and free of cracks.

content.text: In the event that a fin is damaged, cry.

tokens.value: In the event that a fin is damaged, cry.

steps.name: Verify that the fins cannot move radially or axially.
Verify that the rail buttons are fully tightened.
Verify that the following are free of cracks and unintended holes.

content.text:
- Airframe
- Couplers
- Bulkheads

steps.name: Locate the following:

content.text:
- Nose cone subassembly
- Main parachute recovery harness
- Forward airframe

tokens.value:
- Nose cone subassembly
- Main parachute recovery harness
- Forward airframe

headers.name: Forward Nose Cone and Airframe Integration

steps.name: Pass the forward end of the recovery harness through the forward airframe.
Connect the forward end of the recovery harness to the nose cone bulkhead.
Verify the quick link is tight by checking with a teammate.
Slide the nose cone shoulder into the forward airframe.
Connect the nose cone to the forward airframe with 4x 4-40 shear pins.
Push the main parachute into the forward airframe.
Push the recovery harness into the forward airframe.

content.text: Push in small sections to prevent tangling.

steps.name: Insert copious amounts of dog barf.
Cap off the forward airframe.
Locate the following

content.text:
- Aft airframe
- Drogue parachute recovery harness
- ADS subassembly
- Booster subassembly

tokens.value:
- Aft airframe
- Drogue parachute recovery harness
- ADS subassembly
- Booster subassembly

headers.name: Aft Airframe, ADS, and Booster Integration

steps.name: Pass the aft end of the recovery harness through the aft airframe front to back.
Connect the recovery harness to the ADS forward bulkhead.
Verify the quick link is tight by checking with a teammate.
Slide the ADS forward coupler into the aft airframe.
Connect the aft airframe to the ADS coupler with 4x 2-56 shear pins.
Slide the ADS aft coupler into the booster airframe.
Connect the ADS coupler to the booster airframe with 4x 10-32 fasteners.

content.text: These fasteners are locating features. They do not experience load in shear.

tokens.value: These fasteners are locating features. They do not experience load in shear.

steps.name: Insert new alkaline battery in tracker.
Test that the tracker is functional and record its frequency.
Encase tracker in electrical tape to prevent water damage.
Write the tracker frequency on the electrical tape.
Secure the tracker on the drogue shock cord using a zip tie and electrical tape.

content.label: Should be placed near the parachute and the antenna should point towards the parachute.

steps.name: Push the drogue parachute into the aft airframe.
Push the drogue recovery harness into the aft airframe.
Insert copious amounts of dog barf

content.text: Go back and change this wording for NASA

steps.name: Cap off the aft airframe.
Verify team mentor and team members are wearing eye protection.

content.text: The following steps involve black powder ejection charges. Only the team mentor shall handle these charges.

tokens.value: The following steps involve black powder ejection charges. Only the team mentor shall handle these charges.

steps.name: Verify that the RBF tag is fully inserted and that no sounds are audible.
Connect the main recovery harness to the forward avionics bulkhead.
Verify the quick link is tight by checking with a teammate.
Connect the primary main ejection charge.
Connect the backup main ejection charge.
Uncap the forward airframe.
Slide the avionics coupler into the forward airframe.
Connect the forward airframe to the avionics coupler with 4x 10-32 fasteners.
Connect the drogue recovery harness to the aft avionics bulkhead.
Verify the quick link is tight by checking with a teammate.
Connect the primary drogue ejection charge.
Connect the backup drogue ejection charge.
Uncap the aft airframe.
Slide the avionics coupler into the aft airframe.
Connect the avionics coupler to the aft airframe with 4x 10-32 fasteners.
Remove AeroPack motor retainer.
Insert assembled motor until thread contact.
Rotate the motor clockwise to thread onto the ADS stud.
Rotate until the aft closure bottoms out on the retainer.
Attach the retainer.
Verify the retainer is tight by checking with a friend.
Weigh the completed vehicle and record it here.
Place the launch rail in a horizontal position
Slide the vehicle onto the launch rail.

content.text: One person should coordinate the effort. Bending or twisting the vehicle while constrained to the rail can damage the rial buttons.

steps.name: Raise the rail to vertical and verify that it is locked.
Arm the STEMCRaFT Capsule.
Arm the primary altimeter.
Verify three continuity beeps from the primary altimeter.
Verify signal acquisition from primary altimeter ground station.

content.text: The NUSTARS designated frequency is: 435.123

steps.name: Arm the backup altimeter.
Verify three continuity beeps from the primary altimeter.

content.text: There should be a total of six beeps. Two distinct tones in sets of three.

steps.name: Remove the motor cap.
Insert the igniter into the motor.
Re-attach motor cap to hold the igniter in place.
Touch alligator clips to check for stray current.
Connect alligator clips to the igniter wires.
Check igniter for continuity.

content.text: Clear all personnel away from the pad. Continuity checks have the potential to prematurely fire the rocket motor.

steps.name: Clear the pad area and await RSO and LCO launch approval.
If the vehicle produces smoke but does not clear the pad, await RSO approval before troubleshooting the igniter.
Locate the vehicle using visual cues, the RF tracker, or the GPS locator.
Check surroundings around vehicle to ensure no part has landed in a hazardous environment

content.text: Hazardous environments include power lines, trees, or water.

steps.name: Take ample photos of every section of the vehicle.
Disarm both altimeters.
Access any encloses charge locations and verify detonation of all charges.
Record observed damage to the vehicle and recovery system.
Disconnect the primary and drogue recovery harnesses.
Disconnect and bundle the primary and drogue parachutes.
Transport all sections of the vehicle back to base.
Disconnect all vehicle sections and recovery harness hardware.
Clean the inside of the vehicle airframes using isopropyl alcohol.
Disassemble the avionics bay and remove ungrounded electrical connections.
Clean the avionics bay bulkheads using isopropyl alcohol.
Clean the outside of the vehicle with a damp cloth.

content.text: Isopropyl alcohol will degrade paint if present on the vehicle.

comments.text: we will want to add something about testing data logging probably, will figure out today

Its unclear to me where the threaded rod actually goes into the nosecone. The order should be assemble the payload sled, bulkhead, and threaded rod, then insert that assembly into the nosecone. While that assembly is being inserted, the RBF tag should also be put in before the nosecone tip is on. We also might want to do something to clock the sled
we might want to add assembling avionics with RBF tags and testing continuity of avionics connectors
